name: White-headed Vulture
description: The White-headed Vulture is a striking bird with a pale head, known for its solitary scavenging.
food_note: Often feeds alone, preferring smaller carcasses.
proportions: Wingspan: 2-2.3 m, length: 80-90 cm, weight: 4-5 kg.
reproduction: Lays 1 egg in a tree nest, incubation about 40-45 days.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to specific needs, but notable for its appearance.
projects_note: Endangered due to poisoning; conservation programs are critical.
